intro: Afrosersalisia rwandensis, commonly known as the Rwandan serissa, is a rare flowering plant native to the montane forests of Rwanda. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has glossy, dark green leaves. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires protection to ensure its survival.
